channel.title: Shyft on Expert Analytics
channel.description: Recent content in Shyft on Expert Analytics

item.title: Roar Emaus
item.description: Roar has a master’s degree in High Energy Physics from the University of Oslo, completed in 2018. In his thesis he studied two different models of particle production at high energies, one statistical using the thermodynamical equations and one using the properties of a theoretical particle called Pomeron.

item.title: Andreas Slyngstad
item.description: Andreas submitted his master’s thesis in applied mathematics from the University of Oslo and Simula Research Laboratory. In his thesis he investigated numerical schemes, for solving equations describing Fluid-Structure Interaction, using Python and FEniCS. His academic background has given him several tools and approaches for solving complex problems in a computational/software domain.

item.title: Eivind Storm Aarnæs
item.description: Eivind has a masters degree in Computational Science from the University of Oslo, completed in 2016. His project investigated a particle system modeling linear elasticity, and accelerating linear algebra computations using GPUs. From the studies leading to his degree he has gained broad knowledge about algorithms, numerical mathematics, and programming in several languages.

item.title: Vinzenz Gregor Eck
item.description: Vinzenz is a curious, pragmatic, creative problem solver. He holds a PhD in biomechanical engineering, focusing on stochastic simulations of the blood flow in the human arterial system. This interdisciplinary work included working within engineering, medicine, biology, software development and statistics.

item.title: Ola Skavhaug
item.description: Founder and CEO of Expert Analytics. Loves mixing high and low-level languages to combine flexibility with performance.
